member.name: M:OpenDental.Printers.SetPrinter(System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument,OpenDental.PrintSituation)
member.summary: Called from many places in the program. Every single time we print, this function is used to figure out which printer to use. It also handles displaying the dialog if necessary. member.name: M:OpenDental.Printers.ClearAll

member.name: M:OpenDental.Schedules.ConvertFromDefault(System.DateTime,OpenDental.ScheduleType,System.Int32)
member.summary: If a particular day already has some non-default schedule items, then this does nothing and returns false. But if the day is all default, then it converts each default entry into an actual schedule entry and returns true. The user would not notice this change, but now they can edit or add.

member.name: T:OpenDental.TaskList
member.summary: Corresponds to the tasklist table in the database.

member.name: F:OpenDental.TaskList.TaskListNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDental.TaskList.Descript
member.summary: The description of this tasklist. Might be very long, but not usually.

member.name: F:OpenDental.TaskList.Parent
member.summary: The parent task list to which this task list is assigned. If zero, then this task list is on the main trunk of one of the sections.

member.name: F:OpenDental.TaskList.DateTL
member.summary: Optional. Set to 0001-01-01 for no date. If a date is assigned, then this list will also be available from the date section.

member.name: F:OpenDental.TaskList.IsRepeating
member.summary: True if it is to show in the repeating section. There should be no date. All children should also be set to IsRepeating=true.

member.name: F:OpenDental.TaskList.DateType
member.summary: See enum TaskDateType: None,Day,Week,Month. If IsRepeating, then setting to None effectively disables the repeating feature.

member.name: F:OpenDental.TaskList.FromNum
member.summary: If this is derived from a repeating list, then this will hold the ListNum of that list. It helps automate the adding and deleting of lists. It might be deleted automatically if no tasks are marked complete.

member.name: F:OpenDental.TaskList.ObjectType
member.summary: See TaskObjectType enumeration. 0=none,1=Patient,2=Appointment. More will be added later. If a type is selected, then this list will be visible in the appropriate places for attaching the correct type of object. The type is not copied to a task when created. Tasks in this list do not have to be of the same type. You can only attach an object to a task, not a tasklist.

member.name: M:OpenDental.TaskList.Delete
member.summary: Throws exception if any child tasklists or tasks.

member.name: M:OpenDental.TaskLists.Refresh(System.Int32,System.DateTime,OpenDental.TaskDateType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets all tasklists for a given parent. But the 5 trunks don't have parents: For main trunk use date.Min and Parent=0. For Repeating trunk use date.Min isRepeating and Parent=0. For the 3 dated trunks, use a date and a dateType. Date and parent are mutually exclusive. Also used to get all repeating lists for one dateType without any heirarchy: supply parent=-1.

member.name: M:OpenDental.TaskLists.GetForObjectType(OpenDental.TaskObjectType)
member.summary: Gets all task lists with the give object type. Used in TaskListSelect when assigning an object to a task list.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Task
member.summary: Corresponds to the task table in the database.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Task.TaskNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Task.TaskListNum
member.summary: Foreign key to tasklist.TaskListNum. If 0, then it will show in the trunk of a section.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Task.DateTask
member.summary: Only used if this task is assigned to a dated category. Children are NOT dated. Only dated if they should show in the trunk for a date category. They can also have a parent if they are in the main list as well.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Task.KeyNum
member.summary: Foreign key to patient.PatNum or appointment.AptNum. Only used when ObjectType is not 0.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Task.Descript
member.summary: The description of this task. Might be very long.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Task.TaskStatus
member.summary: True if the task has been completed. This could later be turned into an enumeration if more statuses are needed.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Task.IsRepeating
member.summary: True if it is to show in the repeating section. There should be no date. All children and parents should also be set to IsRepeating=true.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Task.DateType
member.summary: See enum TaskDateType: None,Day,Week,Month. If IsRepeating, then setting to None effectively disables the repeating feature.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Task.FromNum
member.summary: If this is derived from a repeating task, then this will hold the TaskNum of that task. It helps automate the adding and deleting of tasks. It might be deleted automatically if not are marked complete.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Task.ObjectType
member.summary: See TaskObjectType enumeration. 0=none,1=Patient,2=Appointment. More will be added later. If a type is selected, then the KeyNum will contain the primary key of the corresponding Patient or Appointment. Does not really have anything to do with the ObjectType of the parent tasklist, although they tend to match.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Task.Delete
member.summary: Deleting a task never causes a problem, so no dependencies are checked.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Tasks.Refresh(System.Int32,System.DateTime,OpenDental.TaskDateType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets all tasks for a given taskList. But the 5 trunks don't have parents: For main trunk use date.Min and TaskListNum=0. For Repeating trunk use date.Min isRepeating and TaskListNum=0. For the 3 dated trunks, use a date and a dateType. Date and TaskListNum are mutually exclusive. Also used to get all repeating tasks for one dateType without any heirarchy: supply listNum=-1.

member.name: T:OpenDental.DataClass
member.summary: Every database table has a corresponding struct or class(new way) of the same or similar name. For instance, the patient table has the Patient class which can store each of the individual values for a single claim row. Each table also has a class with the same or similar name with an 's' on the end, for instance, the Patients class. There are roughly 60 of theses classes, one for every table plus a few extra. Every query to the database goes through the corresponding class. Usually, data from the database is loaded into an array of structs or classes.

member.name: F:OpenDental.DataClass.da
member.summary: This data adapter is used for all queries to the database.

member.name: F:OpenDental.DataClass.con
member.summary: This is the connection that is used by the data adapter for all queries.

member.name: F:OpenDental.DataClass.dr
member.summary: Used to get very small bits of data from the db when the data adapter would be overkill. For instance retrieving the response after a command is sent.

member.name: F:OpenDental.DataClass.cmd
member.summary: Stores the string of the command that will be sent to the database.

member.name: F:OpenDental.DataClass.table
member.summary: After using the FillTable command, this table will have the table that was retrieved from the database.

member.name: F:OpenDental.DataClass.InsertID
member.summary: After inserting a row, this variable will contain the primary key for the newly inserted row. This can frequently save an additional query to the database.

member.name: M:OpenDental.DataClass.SetConnection
member.summary: Sets the connection values.
member.remarks: This is run whenever the connection values have changed by the user and a new connection needs to be established. Usually only when starting the program.

member.name: M:OpenDental.DataClass.FillTable
member.summary: Fills table with data from the database.

member.name: M:OpenDental.DataClass.NonQ(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends a non query command to the database and returns the number of rows affected.
member.param: If true, then InsertID will be set to the value of the primary key of the newly inserted row.

member.summary: eg. ADA2002 or CA Medicaid

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimForm.UniqueID
member.summary: For instance OD12 or JoeDeveloper9. If you are a developer releasing claimforms, then this should be your name or company followed by a unique number. This will later make it easier for you to maintain your claimforms for your customers. All claimforms that we release will be of the form OD##. Reports that the user creates will have this field blank, protecting them from being changed by us.
member.remarks: ADA2002=OD1,Denti-Cal=OD2,ADA2000=OD3,HCFA1500=OD4,HCFA1500preprinted=OD5,Canadian=OD6,Belgian=OD7

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimForm.PrintImages
member.summary: Set to false to not print images. This removes the background for printing on premade forms.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimForm.OffsetX
member.summary: Shifts all items by x/100th's of an inch to compensate for printer, typically less than 1/4 inch.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimForm.OffsetY
member.summary: Shifts all items by y/100th's of an inch to compensate for printer, typically less than 1/4 inch.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimForm.Items
member.summary: This is not a database column. It is an array of all claimformItems that are attached to this ClaimForm.

member.summary: Updates all claimforms with this unique id including all attached items.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimForms.ListLong
member.summary: List of all claim forms.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimForms.ListShort
member.summary: List of all claim forms except those marked as hidden.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ClaimForms.Refresh
member.summary: Fills ListShort and ListLong with all claimforms from the db. Also attaches corresponding claimformitems to each.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ClaimForms.GetClaimForm(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the claim form specified by the given claimFormNum

member.name: T:OpenDental.ClaimPayment
member.summary: Corresponds to the claimpayment table in the database. Each row represents a single check from the insurance company. The amount may be split between patients using claimprocs. The amount of the check must always exactly equal the sum of all the claimprocs attached to it. There might be only one claimproc.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimPayment.ClaimPaymentNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimPayment.CheckDate
member.summary: Date the check was entered into this system, not the date on the check.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimPayment.CheckAmt
member.summary: The amount of the check.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimPayment.CheckNum
member.summary: The check number.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimPayment.BankBranch
member.summary: Bank and branch.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimPayment.Note
member.summary: Note for this check if needed.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimPayment.ClinicNum
member.summary: Foreign key to clinic.ClinicNum

member.name: M:OpenDental.ClaimPayment.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of this ClaimPayment.

member.name: T:OpenDental.ClaimProc
member.summary: Corresponds to the claimproc table in the database.
member.remarks: Links procedures to claims. Also links ins payments to procedures or claims. Also used for estimating procedures even if no claim yet. Warning: One proc might be linked twice to a given claim if insurance made two payments. Many of the important fields are actually optional. For instance, ProcNum is only required if itemizing ins payment, and ClaimNum is blank if Status=adjustment,cap,or estimate.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.ClaimProcNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.ProcNum
member.summary: Foreign key to procedurelog.ProcNum.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.ClaimNum
member.summary: Foreign key to claim.ClaimNum.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.PatNum
member.summary: Foreign key to patient.PatNum.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.ProvNum
member.summary: Foreign key to provider.ProvNum.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.FeeBilled
member.summary: Fee billed to insurance. Might not be the same as the actual fee.
member.remarks: The fee billed can be different than the actual procedure. For instance, if you have set the insurance plan to bill insurance using UCR fees, then this field will contain the UCR fee instead of the fee that the patient was charged.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.InsPayEst
member.summary: Actual amount this carrier is expected to pay, after taking everything else into account. Considers annual max, override, percentAmt, copayAmt, deductible, etc. In this version, not computed until sent to insurance. In a future version, it will be computed automatically but not visible until it is sent to ins. It will be computed ahead of time so that it can be used in treatment plans.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.DedApplied
member.summary: Deductible applied to this procedure only. Will be zero until sent to insurance.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.Status
member.summary: See the ClaimProcStatus enumeration.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.InsPayAmt
member.summary: Amount insurance actually paid.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.Remarks
member.summary: The remarks that insurance sends in the EOB about procedures.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.ClaimPaymentNum
member.summary: Foreign key to ClaimPayment.ClaimPaymentNum(the insurance check).

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.PlanNum
member.summary: Foreign key to insplan.PlanNum

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.DateCP
member.summary: This is the date that is used for payment reports and tracks when the payment was actually made. Always exactly matches the date of the ClaimPayment it's attached to. See the note under Ledgers.ComputePayments. This will eventually not be used for aging. The ProcDate will instead be used. See ProcDate.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.WriteOff
member.summary: Amount not covered by ins which is written off

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.CodeSent
member.summary: The procedure code that was sent to insurance. This is not necessarily the usual procedure code. It will already have been trimmed to 5 char if it started with "D", or it could be the alternate code. Not allowed to be blank if it is procedure.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.AllowedAmt
member.summary: -1 if blank which indicates allowed is same as fee. This is the amount that the percentage is based on. Usually the same as the fee, unless this ins plan has lower UCR. Could also be different for ins substitutions, like posterior composites. If -1, then it might be changed during Procedure.ComputeEstimates/ClaimProc.ComputeBaseEst. But once there is a value, it is guaranteed not to be changed unless user changes it.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.Percentage
member.summary: -1 if blank. Otherwise a number between 0 and 100. The percentage that insurance pays on this procedure, as determined from insurance categories. Not user editable.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.PercentOverride
member.summary: -1 if blank. Otherwise a number between 0 and 100. Can only be changed by user.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.CopayAmt
member.summary: -1 if blank. Calculated automatically. User can not edit but can use CopayOverride instead. Opposite of InsEst, because this is the patient portion estimate. Two different uses: 1. For capitation, this automates calculation of writeoff. 2. For any other insurance, it gets deducted during calculation as shown in the edit window. Neither use directly affects patient balance.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.OverrideInsEst
member.summary: -1 if blank. Lets user override the percentAmt. This field is not updated when recalculating and is only changed by user.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.NoBillIns
member.summary: Set to true to not bill to this insurance plan.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.DedBeforePerc
member.summary: Set true to apply the deductible before the percentage instead of the usual way of applying it after.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.OverAnnualMax
member.summary: -1 if blank. The amount to subtract during estimating because annual benefits have maxed out.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.PaidOtherIns
member.summary: -1 if blank. The amount paid by another insurance. This amount is then subtracted from what the current insurance would pay. So, always blank for primary claims.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.BaseEst
member.summary: Always has a value. Used in TP, etc. The base estimate is the ((fee or allowedAmt)-Copay) x (percentage or percentOverride). Does not include all the extras like ded, annualMax,and paidOtherIns that InsPayEst will hold in future estimating.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.CopayOverride
member.summary: -1 if blank. See description of CopayAmt. This lets the user set a copay that will never be overwritten by automatic calculations.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProc.ProcDate
member.summary: Date of the procedure. Currently only used for tracking annual insurance benefits remaining. Important in Adjustments to benefits. For total claim payments, MUST be the date of the procedures to correctly figure benefits. Will eventually transition to use this field to actually calculate aging. See the note under Ledgers.ComputePayments.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ClaimProc.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of this ClaimProc.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ClaimProc.ComputeBaseEst(OpenDental.Procedure,OpenDental.PriSecTot,OpenDental.Patient,OpenDental.InsPlan[])
member.summary: Calculates the Base estimate for a procedure. This is not done on the fly. Use Procedure.GetEst to later retrieve the estimate. This function duplicates/replaces all of the upper estimating logic that is within FormClaimProc. BaseEst=((fee or allowedAmt)-Copay) x (percentage or percentOverride). The result is now stored in a claimProc. The claimProcs do get updated frequently depending on certain actions the user takes. The calling class must have already created the claimProc, and this function simply updates the BaseEst field of that claimproc. pst.Tot not used. For Estimate and CapEstimate, all the estimate fields will be recalculated except the three overrides.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ClaimProc.CreateEst(OpenDental.Procedure,OpenDental.InsPlan)
member.summary: Used when creating a claim to create any missing claimProcs. Also used in FormProcEdit if click button to add Estimate. Inserts it into db. It will still be altered after this to fill in the fields that actually attach it to the claim.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ClaimProcs.GetForClaim(OpenDental.ClaimProc[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the supplied list into a list of ClaimProcs for one claim.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ClaimProcs.GetForSendClaim(OpenDental.ClaimProc[],System.Int32)
member.summary: When sending or printing a claim, this converts the supplied list into a list of ClaimProcs that need to be sent.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ClaimProcs.GetForProc(OpenDental.ClaimProc[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets all ClaimProcs for the current Procedure. The List must be all ClaimProcs for this patient.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ClaimProcs.ProcDisplayInsEst(OpenDental.ClaimProc[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Used once in Account. The insurance estimate based on all claimprocs with this procNum that are attached to claims. Includes status of NotReceived,Received, and Supplemental. The list can be all ClaimProcs for patient, or just those for this procedure.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ClaimProcs.ProcEstNotReceived(OpenDental.ClaimProc[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Used in Account and in PaySplitEdit. The insurance estimate based on all claimprocs with this procNum, but only for those claimprocs that are not received yet. The list can be all ClaimProcs for patient, or just those for this procedure.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ClaimProcs.ProcInsPay(OpenDental.ClaimProc[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Used in Account and in PaySplitEdit. The insurance amount paid based on all claimprocs with this procNum. The list can be all ClaimProcs for patient, or just those for this procedure.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ClaimProcs.ClaimByTotalOnly(OpenDental.ClaimProc[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Used once in Account on the Claim line. The amount paid on a claim only by total, not including by procedure. The list can be all ClaimProcs for patient, or just those for this claim.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ClaimProcs.SetForClaim(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.DateTime,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Attaches or detaches claimprocs from the specified claimPayment. Updates all claimprocs on a claim with one query. It also updates their DateCP's to match the claimpayment date.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Clearinghouse
member.summary: Corresponds to the clearinghouse table in the database.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Clearinghouse.ClearinghouseNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Clearinghouse.Description
member.summary: Description of this clearinghouse

member.name: F:OpenDental.Clearinghouse.ExportPath
member.summary: The path to export the X12 file to. Includes \.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Clearinghouse.IsDefault
member.summary: Set to true if this is the default clearinghouse to which you want most of your e-claims sent.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Clearinghouse.Payors
member.summary: A list of all payors which should have claims sent to this clearinghouse. Comma delimited with no spaces. Not necessary if IsDefault.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Clearinghouse.Eformat
member.summary: The format of the file that gets sent electronically.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Clearinghouse.ReceiverID
member.summary: The ID of the clearinghouse. Provided by them. Usually goes on ISA08. Examples: BCBSGA or 0135WCH00(webMD)

member.name: F:OpenDental.Clearinghouse.SenderIDold
member.summary: Not used anymore since Open Dental is always the sender. The dental office will be identified by provider rather than by sender.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Clearinghouse.Password
member.summary: Password is usually combined with the login ID for user validation.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Clearinghouse.ResponsePath
member.summary: The path that all incoming response files will be saved to. Includes \.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Clearinghouse.CommBridge
member.summary: One of the included hard-coded communications briges. Or none to just create the claim files without uploading.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Clearinghouse.ClientProgram
member.summary: If applicable, this is the name of the client program to launch. It is even used by the hard-coded comm bridges, because the user may have changed the installation directory or exe name.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Clearinghouse.LastBatchNumber
member.summary: Each clearinghouse increments their batch numbers by one each time a claim file is sent. User never sees this number. Maxes out at 999, then loops back to 1. This field is skipped during all update and retreival except if specifically looking for this one field. Defaults to 0 for brand new clearinghouses, which causes the first batch to go out as #1.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Clearinghouse.ModemPort
member.summary: 1,2,3,or 4. The port that the modem is connected to if applicable. Always uses 9600 baud and standard settings. Will crash if port or modem not valid.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Clearinghouse.LoginID
member.summary: A clearinghouse usually has a login ID that is used with the password in order to access the remote server. This value is not usualy used within the actual claim.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Clearinghouse.Insert
member.summary: Inserts this clearinghouse into database.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Clearinghouse.GetNextBatchNumber
member.summary: Gets the last batch number for this clearinghouse and increments it by one. Saves the new value, then returns it. So even if the new value is not used for some reason, it will have already been incremented. Remember that LastBatchNumber is never accurate with local data in memory.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Clearinghouses.List
member.summary: List of all clearinghouses.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Clearinghouses.HList
member.summary: Key=PayorID. Value=ClearinghouseNum.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Clearinghouses.GetNumForPayor(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the clearinghouseNum for claims for the supplied payorID. If the payorID was not entered or if no default was set, then 0 is returned.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Clearinghouses.GetClearinghouse(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the clearinghouse specified by the given num.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Clearinghouses.GetDefault
member.summary: Returns the default clearinghouse. If no default present, returns null.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Clearinghouses.GetIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the index of this clearinghouse within List

member.name: T:OpenDental.Clinic

member.name: T:OpenDental.Computer

The list will eventually become cluttered with the names of old computers that are no longer in service. The old rows can be safely deleted; that will actually speed up the messaging system.

member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Computer.CompName

member.name: F:OpenDental.Computer.PrinterName

member.name: M:OpenDental.Computers.GetCur

member.name: T:OpenDental.DataConnection
member.summary: This is replacing the DataClass as the preferred way to interact with the database.

member.name: F:OpenDental.DataConnection.da
member.summary: This data adapter is used for all queries to the database.

member.name: F:OpenDental.DataConnection.con
member.summary: This is the connection that is used by the data adapter for all queries.

member.name: F:OpenDental.DataConnection.dr
member.summary: Used to get very small bits of data from the db when the data adapter would be overkill. For instance retrieving the response after a command is sent.

member.name: F:OpenDental.DataConnection.cmd
member.summary: Stores the string of the command that will be sent to the database.

member.name: F:OpenDental.DataConnection.InsertID
member.summary: After inserting a row, this variable will contain the primary key for the newly inserted row. This can frequently save an additional query to the database.

member.name: M:OpenDental.DataConnection.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor sets the connection values.

member.name: M:OpenDental.DataConnection.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the connection to an alternate database for backup purposes. Currently only used during conversions to do a quick backup first, and in FormConfig to get db names.

member.name: M:OpenDental.DataConnection.IsValid
member.summary: Tests to see if the connection is valid.

member.name: M:OpenDental.DataConnection.GetTable(System.String)
member.summary: Fills table with data from the database.

member.name: M:OpenDental.DataConnection.NonQ(System.String)
member.summary: Sends a non query command to the database and returns the number of rows affected. If true, then InsertID will be set to the value of the primary key of the newly inserted row.

member.name: M:OpenDental.DataConnection.NonQ(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends a non query command to the database and returns the number of rows affected. If true, then InsertID will be set to the value of the primary key of the newly inserted row.

member.name: M:OpenDental.DataConnection.NonQ(System.String[])
member.summary: Submits an array of commands in sequence. Used in conversions. Throws an exception if unsuccessful. Returns the number of rows affected

member.name: F:OpenDental.Family.List

member.summary: Tries to get the LastName,FirstName of the patient from this family. If not found, then gets the name from the database.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Family.GetNameInFamLFI(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets last, (preferred) first middle

member.name: M:OpenDental.Family.GetNameInFamFLI(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets (preferred)first middle last

member.name: M:OpenDental.Family.GetIndex(System.Int32)

member.name: M:OpenDental.Family.GetPatient(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a copy of a specific patient from within the family. Does not make a call to the database.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Fee

member.name: F:OpenDental.Fee.FeeNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Fee.Amount
member.summary: The amount usually charged. If an amount is unknown, then the entire Fee entry is deleted from the database. The absence of a fee is sometimes shown in the user interface as a blank entry, and sometimes as 0.00.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Fee.ADACode
member.summary: Foreign key to procedurelog.ADACode.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Fee.FeeSched
member.summary: Foreign key to definition.DefNum.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Fee.UseDefaultFee
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Fee.UseDefaultCov
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Fees.HList
member.summary: An array of hashtables, one for each non-hidden fee schedule. For each hashtable, key is adacode, value is Fee object.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Fees.Refresh
member.summary: Refreshes all fees and loads them into HList array.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Fees.GetFeeByOrder(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Used in FormProcCodeEdit,FormProcedures, and FormClaimProc to get Fees for display and for editing. Returns null if no matching fee found.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Fees.GetAmount(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an amount if a fee has been entered. Otherwise returns -1. Not usually used directly.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Fees.GetAmount0(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Almost the same as GetAmount. But never returns -1; Returns 0 if code can't be found. Returns an amount if a fee has been entered. Otherwise returns -1.

member.name: F:OpenDental.InsPlan.AnnualMax

member.name: F:OpenDental.InsPlan.Deductible

member.name: F:OpenDental.InsPlan.AllowedFeeSched

member.name: F:OpenDental.InsPlan.NumberPlans

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlan.Copy

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlan.Insert

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlan.UpdateForLike(OpenDental.InsPlan)
member.summary: Called from FormInsPlanEditAll. This updates the synchronized fields for all plans like the specified insPlan. Cur must be set to the new values that we want.

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlan.Delete(OpenDental.InsPlan[])

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlan.SamePlans
member.summary: Returns a list of insplans that have identical info as this one. Used to display in the insplan window.

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlan.ComputeEstimatesForCur(OpenDental.Family)
member.summary: Used when closing the edit plan window to find all patients using this plan and to update all claimProcs for each patient. This keeps estimates correct.

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlans.GetPlan(System.Int32,OpenDental.InsPlan[])
member.summary: It's fastest if you supply a plan list that contains the plan, but it also works just fine if it can't initally locate the plan in the list. You can supply an array of length 0. If still not found, returns null.

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlans.Refresh(System.Int32)
member.summary: Only loads one plan from db. Can return null.

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlans.Refresh(OpenDental.Family)
member.summary: Gets new List for the specified family.

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlans.RefreshListAll(System.Boolean)

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlans.GetDescript(System.Int32,OpenDental.Family,OpenDental.InsPlan[])
member.summary: Gets a description of the specified plan, including carrier name and subscriber. It's fastest if you supply a plan list that contains the plan, but it also works just fine if it can't initally locate the plan in the list. You can supply an array of length 0.

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlans.GetCarrierName(System.Int32,OpenDental.InsPlan[])
member.summary: Used in Ins lines in Account module.

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlans.GetInsRem(OpenDental.ClaimProc[],System.DateTime,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenDental.InsPlan[])
member.summary: Get insurance benefits remaining for one benefit year. InsPlans must be refreshed first. Returns actual remaining insurance based on ClaimProc data, taking into account inspayed and ins pending. Must supply all claimprocs for the patient. Date used to determine which benefit year to calc. Usually today's date. The insplan.PlanNum is the plan to get value for. ExcludeClaim is the ClaimNum to exclude, or enter -1 to include all.

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlans.GetPending(OpenDental.ClaimProc[],System.DateTime,System.Int32,OpenDental.InsPlan[])
member.summary: Get pending insurance for a given plan for one benefit year. InsPlans must be refreshed first. Include a ClaimProcList which is all claimProcs for the patient.
member.param: Used to determine which benefit year to calc. Usually today's date.
The insplan.PlanNum to retreive insurance info for.
member.returns: Returns the amount of insurance pending based on ClaimProc data.

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlans.GetDedRem(OpenDental.ClaimProc[],System.DateTime,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenDental.InsPlan[])
member.summary: Gets the deductible remaining for an insurance plan for one benefit year which includes the given date. InsPlans must be refreshed first. ClaimProcList should be the entire list of claimprocs for the patient. You can exclude a claim or use -1 to include all.

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlans.GetCopay(System.String,System.Int32,OpenDental.InsPlan[])
member.summary: Returns -1 if no copay feeschedule or fee unknown for this adaCode. Otherwise, returns 0 or more for a patient copay. Can handle a planNum of 0.

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlans.GetAllowed(System.String,System.Int32,OpenDental.InsPlan[])
member.summary: Returns -1 if no allowed feeschedule or fee unknown for this adaCode. Otherwise, returns the allowed fee including 0. Can handle a planNum of 0.

member.name: M:OpenDental.InsPlans.GetHListAll
member.summary: This is used in FormQuery.SubmitQuery to allow display of carrier names.

member.summary: Set to true to indicate that a payment is split between patients. Just makes a few functions easier. Might be eliminated.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Payment.PatNum
member.summary: Foreign Key to patient.PatNum. The patient where the payment entry will show. But only the splits affect accounts.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Payment.ClinicNum
member.summary: Foreign Key to clinic.ClinicNum. Can be 0. Copied from patient.ClinicNum when creating payment, but user can override.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Payment.Update
member.summary: Updates this payment. Also updates the datePay of all attached paysplits so that they are always in synch. Updates IsSplit. DatePay and IsSplit are also updated whenever a paysplit is added or removed, so no need to run this again.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Payment.Delete
member.summary: Deletes the payment as well as all splits. Also updates all necessary EstBals

member.name: M:OpenDental.Payment.Allocate
member.summary: Only Called only from FormPayment.butOK click. Only called if the user did not enter any splits. Usually just adds one split for the current patient. But if that would take the balance negative, then it loops through all other family members and creates splits for them. It might still take the current patient negative once all other family members are zeroed out.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Payments.Refresh(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets all payments for the specified patient. This has NOTHING to do with pay splits. Must use pay splits for accounting. This is only for display in Account module.

member.summary: Not used anymore. In version 3.0, this was moved to the claimproc table.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Procedure.PlaceService

member.summary: Set true to hide this procedure on the graphical tooth chart. Typically set after a tooth is extracted.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Procedure.DateOriginalProsth
member.summary: For a prosthesis Replacement, this is the original date.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Procedure.ClaimNote
member.summary: This note will go on e-claim. For By Report, prep dates, or initial endo date.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Procedure.DateLocked
member.summary: The date that the note was locked. If no date entered, then note is not locked. If date entered, also prevents deletion and changing status.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Procedure.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of the procedure.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Procedure.Insert
member.summary: Inserts to db, and also sets the ProcNum.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Procedure.Update(OpenDental.Procedure)
member.summary: Updates only the changed columns and returns the number of rows affected.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Procedure.Delete
member.summary: Also deletes any claimProcs. Must test to make sure claimProcs are not part of a payment first.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Procedure.GetEst(OpenDental.ClaimProc[],OpenDental.PriSecTot,OpenDental.Patient)
member.summary: Base estimate or override is retrieved from supplied claimprocs. Does not take into consideration annual max or deductible, but it does limit total of pri+sec to not be more than total. The claimProc array typically includes all claimProcs for the patient, but must at least include all claimprocs for this proc.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Procedure.GetWriteOff(OpenDental.ClaimProc[])
member.summary: Gets total writeoff for this procedure based on supplied claimprocs. Includes all claimproc types. Only used in main TP module. The claimProc array typically includes all claimProcs for the patient, but must at least include all claimprocs for this proc.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Procedure.GetWriteOffC(OpenDental.ClaimProc[])
member.summary: WriteOff'Complete'. Only used in main Account module. Gets writeoff for this procedure based on supplied claimprocs. Only includes claimprocs with status of CapComplete,CapClaim,NotReceived,Received,or Supplemental. BUT only includes Writeoffs not attached to claims, because those will display on the claim line. In practice, this means only writeoffs with CapComplete status get returned because they are to be subtracted from the patient portion on the proc line. The claimProc array typically includes all claimProcs for the patient, but must at least include all claimprocs for this proc.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Procedure.ComputeEstimates(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenDental.ClaimProc[],System.Boolean,OpenDental.Patient,OpenDental.InsPlan[])
member.summary: Used whenever a procedure changes or a plan changes. All estimates for a given procedure must be updated. This frequently includes adding claimprocs, but can also just edit the appropriate existing claimprocs. Skips status=Adjustment,CapClaim,Preauth,Supplemental. Also fixes date,status,and provnum if appropriate. The claimProc array can be all claimProcs for the patient, but must at least include all claimprocs for this proc. Only set IsInitialEntry true from Chart module; this is for cap procs.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Procedure.IsCoveredIns(OpenDental.ClaimProc[])
member.summary: Used in deciding how to display procedures in Account. The claimProcList can be all claimProcs for the patient or only those attached to this proc. Will be true if any claimProcs at all are attached to this procedure.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Procedure.NoBillIns(OpenDental.ClaimProc[])
member.summary: Used in deciding how to display procedures in Account. The claimProcList can be all claimProcs for the patient or only those attached to this proc. Will be true if any claimProcs attached to this procedure are set NoBillIns.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Procedure.NoBillIns(OpenDental.ClaimProc[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Used in ContrAccount.CreateClaim when validating selected procedures. Returns true if there is any claimproc for this procedure and plan which is marked NoBillIns. The claimProcList can be all claimProcs for the patient or only those attached to this proc. Will be true if any claimProcs attached to this procedure are set NoBillIns.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Procedure.IsUnsent(OpenDental.ClaimProc[])
member.summary: Used in deciding how to display procedures in Account. The claimProcList can be all claimProcs for the patient or only those attached to this proc. Will be true if any claimProcs attached to this procedure are status estimate, which means they haven't been attached to a claim because their status would have been changed to NotReceived. And if the patient doesn't have ins, then the estimates would have been deleted.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Procedure.IsAttachedToClaim(OpenDental.ClaimProc[])
member.summary: Only called from FormProcEdit to signal when to disable much of the editing in that form. If the procedure is 'AttachedToClaim' then user should not change it very much. The claimProcList can be all claimProcs for the patient or only those attached to this proc.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Procedure.IsAlreadyAttachedToClaim(OpenDental.ClaimProc[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Used in ContrAccount.CreateClaim to validate that procedure is not already attached to a claim for this specific insPlan. The claimProcList can be all claimProcs for the patient or only those attached to this proc.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Procedure.InsHasPaid(OpenDental.ClaimProc[])
member.summary: Only used in FormProcEdit.Delete to prevent deletion of procedures with payments attached. Tests to see if any payment at all has been received for this proc. The list can be all ClaimProcs for patient, or just those for this procedure.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Procedure.NeedsSent(OpenDental.ClaimProc[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Only used in ContrAccount.OnInsClick to automate selection of procedures. Returns true if this procedure should be selected. This happens if there is at least one claimproc attached for this plan that is an estimate, and it is not set to NoBillIns. The list can be all ClaimProcs for patient, or just those for this procedure. The plan is the primary plan.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Procedure.GetClaimProcEstimate(OpenDental.ClaimProc[],OpenDental.InsPlan)
member.summary: Only used in ContrAccount.CreateClaim to decide whether a given procedure has an estimate that can be used to attach to a claim for the specified plan. Returns a valid claimProc if this procedure has an estimate attached that is not set to NoBillIns. The list can be all ClaimProcs for patient, or just those for this procedure. Returns null if there are no claimprocs that would work.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Procedures.SetDateFirstVisit(System.DateTime,System.Int32,OpenDental.Patient)
member.summary: Sets the patient.DateFirstVisit if necessary. A visitDate is required to be passed in because it may not be today's date. This is triggered by: 1. When any procedure is inserted regardless of status. From Chart or appointment. If no C procs and date blank, changes date. 2. When updating a procedure to status C. If no C procs, update visit date. Ask user first? 3. When an appointment is deleted. If no C procs, clear visit date. 4. Changing an appt date of type IsNewPatient. If no C procs, change visit date. Old: when setting a procedure complete in the Chart module or the ProcEdit window. Also when saving an appointment that is marked IsNewPat.

member.name: T:OpenDental.ProcDesc

member.name: T:OpenDental.Recall
member.summary: Corresponds to the recall table in the database. See remarks for sychronization details.
member.remarks:
A patient can only have one recall date set for each type (there is currently only one type). The recall table stores a few dates that must be kept synchronized with other information in the database. This is difficult. Anytime one of the following items changes, things need to be synchronized: procedurecode.SetRecall, any procedurelog change for a patient (procs added, deleted, completed, status changed, date changed, etc), patient status changed. There are expected to be a few bugs in the synchronization logic, so anytime a patient's recall is opened, it will also update.
During synchronization, the program will frequently alter DateDueCalc, DateDue, and DatePrevious based on trigger procs. The system will also add and delete recalls as necessary. But it will not delete a recall unless all values are default and there is no useful information. When a user tries to delete a recall, they will only be successful if the trigger conditions do not apply. Otherwise, they will have to disable the recall instead.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Recall.RecallNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Recall.PatNum
member.summary: Foreign key to patient.PatNum.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Recall.DateDueCalc
member.summary: Not editable. The calculated date due. Generated by the program and subject to change anytime the conditions change. It can be blank (0001-01-01) if no appropriate triggers.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Recall.DateDue
member.summary: This is the date that is actually used when doing reports for recall. It will usually be the same as DateDueCalc unless user has changed it. System will only update this field if it is the same as DateDueCalc. Otherwise, it will be left alone. Gets cleared along with DateDueCalc when resetting recall. When setting disabled, this field will also be cleared. This is the field to use if converting from another software.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Recall.DatePrevious
member.summary: Not editable. Previous date that procedures were done to trigger this recall. It is calculated and enforced automatically. If you want to affect this date, add a procedure to the chart with a status of C, EC, or EO.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Recall.RecallInterval
member.summary: The interval between recalls. See the Interval struct for an explanation.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Recall.RecallStatus
member.summary: Foreign key to Definition.DefNum, or 0 for none.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Recall.Note
member.summary: An administrative note for staff use.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Recall.IsDisabled
member.summary: If true, this recall type will be disabled (there's only one type right now). This is usually used rather deleting the recall type from the patient because the program must enforce the trigger conditions for all patients.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Recall.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of this Recall.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Recall.IsAllDefault
member.summary: Will only return true if not disabled, date previous is empty, DateDue is same as DateDueCalc, etc.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Interval
member.summary: Currently used in recall interval. Uses all four values together to establish an interval between two dates, letting the user have total control. Will later be used for such things as lab cases, appointment scheduling, etc. Includes a way to combine all four values into one number to be stored in the database (as an int32). Each value has a max of 255, except years has a max of 127.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Carrier

member.summary: A hashtable of all carriers.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Carriers.Refresh
member.summary: Carriers are not refreshed as local data, but are refreshed as needed. A full refresh is frequently triggered if a carrierNum cannot be found in the HList. Important retrieval is done directly from the db.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Carriers.DeleteCur
member.summary: There MUST not be any dependencies before calling this or there will be invalid foreign keys. This is only called from FormCarrierEdit after proper validation.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Carriers.DependentPlans
member.summary: Returns a list of insplans that are dependent on the Cur carrier. Used to display in carrier edit and before deleting a carrier to make sure carrier is not in use.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Carriers.GetName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the name of a carrier based on the employerNum. This also refreshes the list if necessary, so it will work even if the list has not been refreshed recently.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Carriers.GetCur(System.Int32)
member.summary: Getting phased out. Sets Cur to the carrier based on the carrierNum. This also refreshes the list if necessary, so it will work even if the list has not been refreshed recently..

member.name: M:OpenDental.Carriers.GetCarrier(System.Int32)
member.summary: Replacing GetCur. Gets the specified carrier. This also refreshes the list if necessary, so it will work even if the list has not been refreshed recently.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Carriers.GetCurSame
member.summary: Gets a carrierNum based on the other data in Cur. If there is no matching carrier, then a new carrier is created. The end result is that a valid Cur will always be set.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Carriers.GetSimilarNames(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an arraylist of Carriers with names similar to the supplied string. Used in dropdown list from carrier field for faster entry. There is a small chance that the list will not be completely refreshed when this is run, but it won't really matter if one carrier doesn't show in dropdown.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Carriers.Combine(System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Combines all the given carriers into one. The carrier that will be used as the basis of the combination is specified in the usingIndex parameter. Updates insplan, then deletes all the other carriers.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Claim
member.summary: Corresponds to the claim table in the database.
member.remarks: The claim table holds information about individual claims. Each row represents one claim.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.ClaimNum
member.summary: Primary key

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.PatNum

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.DateService
member.summary: Usually the same date as the procedures, but it can be changed if you wish.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.DateSent
member.summary: Usually the date it was created. It might be sent a few days later if you don't send your e-claims every day.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.ClaimStatus
member.summary: Single char: U,H,W,P,S,or R.
member.remarks: U=Unsent, H=Hold until pri received, W=Waiting in queue, P=Probably sent, S=Sent, R=Received. A(adj) is no longer used.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.DateReceived
member.summary: Date the claim was received.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.PlanNum
member.summary: Foreign key to InsPlan.PlanNum

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.ProvTreat

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.ClaimFee
member.summary: Total fee of claim.

member.summary: Amount insurance is estimated to pay on this claim.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.InsPayAmt
member.summary: Amount insurance actually paid.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.DedApplied
member.summary: Deductible applied to this claim.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.PreAuthString
member.summary: The preauth number received from ins.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.IsProsthesis
member.summary: single char for No, Initial, or Replacement.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.PriorDate

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.ReasonUnderPaid
member.summary: Note for patient for why insurance didn't pay as expected.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.ClaimNote
member.summary: Note to be sent to insurance. Max 255 char.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.ClaimType
member.summary: "P"=primary, "S"=secondary, "PreAuth"=preauth, "Other"=other, "Cap"=capitation
member.remarks: ClaimType is the new way of determining claimtype. Not allowed to be blank. The update for version 2.1 added "P" or "S" to all existing claims.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.ProvBill
member.summary: Billing provider. Foreign key to Provider.ProvNum.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.ReferringProv
member.summary: Foreign key to Referral.ReferralNum.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.RefNumString
member.summary: Referral number for this claim.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.PlaceService
member.summary: See the PlaceOfService enum.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.AccidentRelated
member.summary: blank or A=Auto, E=Employment, O=Other.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.AccidentDate
member.summary: Date of accident, if applicable.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.AccidentST
member.summary: Accident state.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.EmployRelated
member.summary: See the YN enum.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.IsOrtho
member.summary: True if is ortho.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.OrthoRemainM
member.summary: Remaining months of ortho. Valid values are 1-36.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.OrthoDate
member.summary: Date ortho appliance placed.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.PatRelat
member.summary: Relationship to subscriber. See the Relat enumeration.
member.remarks: You no longer have to look in patient to find the relationship, since it is copied over when the claim is created.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.PlanNum2
member.summary: Other coverage plan number. Foreign key to InsPlan.PlanNum for other coverage. 0 if none.
member.remarks: This provides the user with total control over what other coverage shows. This obviously limits the coverage on a single claim to two insurance companies.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.PatRelat2
member.summary: The relationsip to the subscriber for other coverage on this claim.

member.summary: Sum of ClaimProc.Writeoff for this claim.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Claim.Radiographs
member.summary: The number of x-rays enclosed.

member.summary: Gets the specified claim from the database.

member.summary: Gets all claims for the specified patient.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Claims.GetQueueList
member.summary: Called from claimsend window.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Claims.GetX12TransactionInfo(System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Supply an arrayList of type ClaimSendQueueItem. Called from X12 to begin the sorting process on claims going to one clearinghouse. Returns an array with Carrier,ProvBill,Subscriber,PatNum,ClaimNum, all in the correct order. Carrier is a string, the rest are int.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Claims.CalculateAndUpdate(OpenDental.ClaimProc[],OpenDental.Procedure[],OpenDental.Patient,OpenDental.InsPlan[],OpenDental.Claim)
member.summary: Updates all claimproc estimates and also updates claim totals to db. Must supply all claimprocs for this patient. Must supply procList which includes all procedures that this claim is linked to. Will also need to refresh afterwards to see the results

member.name: T:OpenDental.CovCat
member.summary: Corresponds to the covcat table in the database.

member.name: F:OpenDental.CovCat.CovCatNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDental.CovCat.Description
member.summary: Description of this category.

member.name: F:OpenDental.CovCat.DefaultPercent
member.summary: Default percent for this category.

member.name: F:OpenDental.CovCat.IsPreventive
member.summary: True if this is a preventive category.

member.name: F:OpenDental.CovCat.CovOrder
member.summary: The order in which the categories are displayed.

member.name: F:OpenDental.CovCat.IsHidden
member.summary: If true, this category will be hidden.

member.name: T:OpenDental.CovPat
member.summary: Corresponds to the covpat table in the database.
member.remarks: Coverage percentage for a patient. Each entry in this table is a single percentage value. A covpat can have a value in ONLY ONE of these three fields: PlanNum, PriPatNum, or SecPatNum. If it is for a PlanNum, then the percentage is attached to an insurance plan. If it is one of the others, then it is attached to the coverage for a patient, either primary or secondary, and overrides the plan percentage.

member.name: F:OpenDental.CovPat.CovPatNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDental.CovPat.CovCatNum
member.summary: Foreign key to covcat.CovCatNum.

member.name: F:OpenDental.CovPat.PlanNum
member.summary: OPT 1: Foreign key to insplan.PlanNum.

member.name: F:OpenDental.CovPat.PriPatNum
member.summary: OPT 2: Foreign key to patient.PatNum for primary coverage.

member.name: F:OpenDental.CovPat.SecPatNum
member.summary: OPT 3: Foreign key to patient.PatNum for secondary coverage.

member.name: F:OpenDental.CovPat.Percent
member.summary: Valid values are 0 to 100. If unknown, the covpat is simply deleted.

member.name: M:OpenDental.CovPats.Refresh(OpenDental.Patient,OpenDental.InsPlan[])
member.summary: Gets the PriList and SecList based on the combination of 4 possible percentages.

member.name: M:OpenDental.CovPats.GetPercent(System.String,OpenDental.PriSecTot)
member.summary: Only use pri or sec, not tot. Used from ClaimProc.ComputeBaseEst. This is a low level function to get the percent to store in a claimproc. It does not consider any percentOverride. Always returns a number between 0 and 100.

member.name: T:OpenDental.CovSpan

member.summary: Foreign key

member.name: F:OpenDental.CovSpan.FromCode
member.summary: Foreign key to procedurecode.ADACode.

member.name: F:OpenDental.CovSpan.ToCode
member.summary: Foreign key to procedurecode.ADACode.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Def
member.summary: Corresponds to the definition table in the database.
member.remarks: Almost every table in the database links to definition. Almost all links to this table will be to a DefNum. Using the DefNum, you can find any of the other fields of interest, usually the ItemName. Make sure to look at the Defs class to see how the definitions are loaded into memory ahead of time.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Def.DefNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Def.Category
member.summary: See the DefCat enumeration.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Def.ItemOrder
member.summary: Order that each item shows on various lists.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Def.ItemName
member.summary: Each category is a little different. This field is usually the common name of the item.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Def.ItemValue
member.summary: This field can be used to store extra info about the item.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Def.ItemColor
member.summary: Some categories include a color option.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Def.IsHidden
member.summary: If hidden, the item will not show on any list, but can still be referenced.

members.member: Handles database commands related to the definition table in the db.\ This class is referenced frequently from many different areas of the program. It stores data from the definition table in a couple of two dimensional arrays for immediate retrieval.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Defs.List
member.summary: For only one category. Only used in FormDefinitions.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Defs.Cur
member.summary: Current definition.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Defs.IsSelected
member.summary: Only used in the defs window

member.name: F:OpenDental.Defs.Selected
member.summary: Keeps track of the selected row in the defs window.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Defs.Short
member.summary: Stores all defs in a 2D array except the hidden ones.
member.remarks: The first dimension is the category, in int format. The second dimension is the index of the definition in this category. This is dependent on how it was refreshed, and not on what is in the database. If you need to reference a specific def, then the DefNum is more effective.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Defs.Long
member.summary: Stores all defs in a 2D array.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Defs.GetOrder(OpenDental.DefCat,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the order of the def within Short or -1 if not found.

member.name: T:OpenDental.DocAttach

member.remarks: Links documents (images) to patients. This will allow one document to be shared between multiple patients in a future version.

member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDental.DocAttach.PatNum
member.summary: Foreign key to patient.PatNum.

member.name: F:OpenDental.DocAttach.DocNum
member.summary: Foreign key document.DocNum.

member.name: M:OpenDental.DocAttaches.Refresh(System.Int32)
member.summary: For one patient. This should be followed by Documents.Refresh

member.name: T:OpenDental.Document

member.name: F:OpenDental.Document.DocNum

member.name: F:OpenDental.Document.Description
member.summary: Description of the document.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Document.DateCreated

member.summary: The name of the file. Does not include any directory info.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Document.ImgType
member.summary: eg. document, radiograph, photo, file

member.summary: True if flipped horizontally. A vertical flip would be stored as a horizontal flip plus a 180 rotation.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Document.DegreesRotated
member.summary: Only allowed 0,90,180, and 270.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Documents
member.summary: Handles images for the Images module

member.name: M:OpenDental.Documents.Refresh
member.summary: This is refreshed after DocAttaches.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Documents.InsertCur(OpenDental.Patient)
member.summary: Inserts a new document into db, creates a filename based on Cur.DocNum, and then updates the db with this filename. Also attaches the document to the current patient.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Documents.GetCurrent(System.String)
member.summary: Loops through List to find Cur based on docNum.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Documents.GetCategory(System.String)
member.summary: Used when dragging to a new category. Loops through List to find the defNum of the category based on docNum.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Documents.IsFileNameInList(System.String)
member.summary: When first openning the image module, this tests to see whether a given filename is in the database. Also used when naming a new document to ensure unique name.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Documents.GetPaths(System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: This is used by FormImageViewer to get a list of paths based on supplied list of DocNums. The reason is that later we will allow sharing of documents, so the paths may not be in the current patient folder.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Documents.GetPatPict(System.Int32)
member.summary: Makes one call to the database to retrieve the filename of the patient pict for the given patNum. Assumes WithPat will always be same as patnum.

member.name: T:OpenDental.ElectID
member.summary: Corresponds to the electid table in the database. Never editable by users. We keep this table updated with new numbers as part of upgrades, so NEVER edit this table as it will mess up our primary keys. Helps with entering elecronic/payor id's as well as keeping track of the specific carrier requirements. Only used by the X12 format.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ElectID.ElectIDNum
member.summary: Primary key.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ElectID.PayorID
member.summary: aka Electronic ID. A simple string.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ElectID.CarrierName
member.summary: As published. Not editable. Used when doing a search.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ElectID.IsMedicaid
member.summary: True if medicaid. Then, the billing and treating providers will have their Medicaid ID's attached.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ElectID.ProviderTypes
member.summary: Integers separated by commas. Each int represents a ProviderSupplementalID type that is required by this insurance. Usually only used for BCBS or other carriers that require supplemental provider id's. Even if we don't put the supplemental types in here, the user can still add them. This just helps by doing an additional check for known required types.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ElectID.Comments
member.summary: Any comments. Usually includes enrollment requirements and descriptions of how to use the provider id's supplied by the carrier because they might call them by different names.

member.name: T:OpenDental.ElectIDs
member.summary: Refreshed with local data.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ElectIDs.List
member.summary: This is the list of all electronic IDs.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ElectIDs.Refresh
member.summary: Since users not allowed to edit, this only gets run on startup.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ElectIDs.GetID(System.String)
member.summary: Gets ONE ElectID that uses the supplied payorID. Even if there are multiple payors using that ID. So use this carefully.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ElectIDs.GetIDs(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an arrayList of ElectID objects based on a supplied payorID. If no matches found, then returns array of 0 length. Used to display payors in FormInsPlan and also to get required idents. This means that all payors with the same ID should have the same required idents and notes.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ElectIDs.GetDescripts(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the names of the payors to display based on the payorID. Since carriers sometimes share payorIDs, there will often be multiple payor names returned.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Employers
member.summary: Employers are not refreshed as local data, but are refreshed as needed. A full refresh is frequently triggered if an employerNum cannot be found in the HList. Important retrieval is done directly from the db.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Employers.HList
member.summary: A hashtable of all employers.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Employers.Refresh
member.summary: The functions that use this are smart enought to refresh as needed. So no need to invalidate local data for little stuff.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Employers.DeleteCur
member.summary: There MUST not be any dependencies before calling this or there will be invalid foreign keys. This is only called from FormEmployers after proper validation.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Employers.DependentPatients
member.summary: Returns a list of patients that are dependent on the Cur employer. The list includes carriage returns for easy display. Used before deleting an employer to make sure employer is not in use.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Employers.DependentInsPlans
member.summary: Returns a list of insplans that are dependent on the Cur employer. The list includes carriage returns for easy display. Used before deleting an employer to make sure employer is not in use.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Employers.GetName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the name of an employer based on the employerNum. This also refreshes the list if necessary, so it will work even if the list has not been refreshed recently.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Employers.GetEmployer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an employer based on the employerNum. This will work even if the list has not been refreshed recently, but if you are going to need a lot of names all at once, then it is faster to refresh first.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Employers.GetEmployerNum(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an employerNum based on the supplied name. If that empName does not exist, then a new employer is created.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Employers.GetSimilarNames(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an arraylist of Employers with names similar to the supplied string. Used in dropdown list from employer field for faster entry. There is a small chance that the list will not be completely refreshed when this is run, but it won't really matter if one employer doesn't show in dropdown.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Employers.Combine(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Combines all the given employers into one. Updates patient and insplan. Then deletes all the others.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Language

member.name: F:OpenDental.Language.EnglishComments
member.summary: Comments by us regarding usage.

member.summary: A string representing the class where the translation is used. Maximum length is 25 characters.

member.summary: The English version of the phrase, case sensitive.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Language.IsObsolete
member.summary: As this gets more sophisticated, we will use this field to mark some phrases obsolete instead of just deleting them outright. That way, translators will still have access to them.

member.summary: Used by g to keep track of whether any language items were inserted into db. If so a refresh gets done.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Lan.Refresh

member.name: M:OpenDental.Lan.InsertCur
member.summary: Tries to insert, but ignores the insert if this row already exists. This prevents the previous frequent crashes.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Lan.UpdateCur

member.summary: Converts a string to the current language.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Lan.C(System.String,System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem)
member.summary: C is for control. Translates the text of this control to another language.

member.summary: F is for Form. Translates the following controls on the entire form: title Text, labels, buttons, groupboxes, checkboxes, radiobuttons. Can include a list of controls to exclude. Also puts all the correct controls into the All category (OK,Cancel,Close,Delete,etc).

member.name: M:OpenDental.Lan.F(System.Windows.Forms.Form,System.Windows.Forms.Control[])
member.summary: F is for Form. Translates the following controls on the entire form: title Text, labels, buttons, groupboxes, checkboxes, radiobuttons. Can include a list of controls to exclude. Also puts all the correct controls into the All category (OK,Cancel,Close,Delete,etc).

member.name: M:OpenDental.Lan.Fchildren(System.Windows.Forms.Form,System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Windows.Forms.Control[])
member.summary: Called from F and also recursively. Translates all children of the given control except those in the exclusions list.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Ledgers
member.summary: This does not correspond to any table in the database. It works with a variety of tables to calculate aging.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Ledgers.ComputePayments(OpenDental.Ledgers.DateValuePair[])
member.summary: Called 4 times from the above function. Not needed for charges, but only for payments, which are much more complex to place in the correct aging slot. Hopefully, the complexity will be reduced when we have line item accounting, and every payment will have a proc date as well as a payment date. Payment date will be used for all reports that show payments. ProcDate will be used for aging. This is already mostly in place for claimproc.ProcDate and claimproc.DateCP.

member.name: T:OpenDental.PayPlan
member.summary: Corresponds to the payplan table in the database. Each row represents one signed agreement to make payments.

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayPlan.PayPlanNum
member.summary: Primary key

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayPlan.PatNum
member.summary: Foreign key to patient.PatNum. The patient who had the treatment done.

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayPlan.Guarantor
member.summary: Foreign key to patient.PatNum. The person responsible for the payments. Does not need to be in the same family as the patient.

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayPlan.PayPlanDate
member.summary: Date that the payment plan was started.

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayPlan.TotalAmount
member.summary: Total amount financed.

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayPlan.APR
member.summary: Annual percentage rate. eg 18. This does not take into consideration any late payments, but only the percentage used to determine the current amount due.

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayPlan.MonthlyPayment
member.summary: Amount of payment agreed to for each month

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayPlan.Term
member.summary: Number of months agreed for payment.

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayPlan.CurrentDue
member.summary: The current amount due not taking into account payments made. Updated every time it's loaded. Also updated using the update tool.

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayPlan.DateFirstPay
member.summary: Date first payment is due.

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayPlan.DownPayment
member.summary: The amount of downpayment not counting the first payment.

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayPlan.Note
member.summary: Generally used to archive the terms so they don't accidently get changed.

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayPlan.TotalCost
member.summary: Calculated in the payment plan edit window, then stored here. Current due will never go over the total cost amount.

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayPlan.LastPayment
member.summary: The amount of the last payment in the series. Usually 0 or at least less than the usual monthly payment.

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayPlans.List
member.summary: List of all payplans for a given patient, whether they are the guarantor or the patient. This is also used in UpdateAll to store all payment plans in entire database.

member.name: M:OpenDental.PayPlans.Refresh(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Refresh List for the specified guarantor and patient.

member.name: M:OpenDental.PayPlans.DeleteCur
member.summary: Must have already verified that there are no paysplits attached. Called from FormPayPlan.

member.name: M:OpenDental.PayPlans.UpdateAll(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Recalculates the CurrentDue for all payment plans based on the specified date. Does not take into account any payments made.

member.name: M:OpenDental.PayPlans.GetAmtDue(System.Double,System.Double,System.DateTime,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the amount due for the current payment plan based on today's date. It is simply the number of months x monthly payment. Includes interest, but does not include payments made so far.

member.name: M:OpenDental.PayPlans.GetMonthsDue(System.DateTime)
member.summary: For the Cur payment plan, gets the number of months, rounded up, between the first payment date and today's date. This is the number of payments that are due. Used from GetAmtDue() and from FormPayPlan. The last payment may be a partial payment. The number of months due may actually be much larger than the number of payments that were agreed upon. That's ok, because total cost will still be accurate.

member.name: M:OpenDental.PayPlans.GetAmtPaid(System.Int32)
member.summary: Used from PayPlan window to get the amount paid so far on one payment plan.

member.name: M:OpenDental.PayPlans.ComputeBal(System.Int32)
member.summary: Must make sure Refresh is done first. Returns the sum of all payment plan entries for guarantor and/or patient.

member.name: M:OpenDental.PayPlans.GetValidPlan(System.Int32)
member.summary: Refreshes the list for the specified guarantor, and then determines if there are any valid plans with that patient as the guarantor. If more than one valid payment plan, displays list to select from. If any valid plans, then it sets Cur, else returns false.

member.name: T:OpenDental.PIn
member.summary: Converts strings coming in from the database into the appropriate type. "P" was originally short for Parameter because this class was written specifically to replace parameters in the mysql queries. Using strings instead of parameters is much easier to debug. This will later be rewritten as a System.IConvertible interface on custom mysql types. I would rather not ever depend on the mysql connector for this so that this program remains very db independent.

member.name: M:OpenDental.PIn.PDouble(System.String)
member.summary: If blank or invalid, returns 0. Otherwise, parses.

member.name: T:OpenDental.POut
member.summary: Converts various datatypes into strings formatted correctly for MySQL. "P" was originally short for Parameter because this class was written specifically to replace parameters in the mysql queries. Using strings instead of parameters is much easier to debug. This will later be rewritten as a System.IConvertible interface on custom mysql types. I would rather not ever depend on the mysql connector for this so that this program remains very db independent.

member.name: M:OpenDental.POut.PDate(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Converts a date to yyyy-MM-dd format which is the format required by MySQL.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Screen
member.summary: Corresponds to the screen table in the database. Used in public health.
member.remarks: This screening table is meant to be general purpose. It is compliant with the popular Basic Screening Survey. It is also designed with minimal foreign keys and can be easily adapted to a palm or pocketPC. This table can be used with only the screengroup table, but is more efficient if provider, school, and county tables are also available.

member.summary: Foreign key to school.SchoolName, although it will not crash if key absent.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Screen.County
member.summary: Foreign key to county.CountyName, although it will not crash if key absent.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Screen.PlaceService
member.summary: See the PlaceOfService enum.

member.summary: Foreign key to provider.ProvNum. ProvNAME is always entered, but ProvNum supplements it by letting user select from list. When entering a provNum, the name will be filled in automatically. Can be 0 if the provider is not in the list, but provName is required.

member.name: M:OpenDental.FormClaimPrint.FillProcStrings(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.param: For page 1, this will be 0, otherwise it might be 10, 8, 20, or whatever. It is the 0-based index of the first proc. Depends on how many procedures this claim format can display and which page we are on.

member.summary: Need to pass in the current patNum which is not necessarily the subscriber. But InsPlans do not have a field for PatNum. The result is that the displayed family list might change depending on which family is open when this form is called. Subscriber is independent of family.

member.name: M:OpenDental.FormInsPlan.FillFormData
member.summary: Fills the form based on the data in PlanCur. Includes calls to FillSubscriber, FillCarrier, FillPercentages, and LayoutSynch.

member.name: M:OpenDental.FormInsPlan.FillCarrier
member.summary: Fills the carrier fields on the form based on CarrierCur.

member.name: M:OpenDental.FormInsPlan.FillPayor

member.name: M:OpenDental.FormInsPlan.FillPercentages
member.summary: Gets percentages from the db and then displays them on the form.

member.name: M:OpenDental.FormInsPlan.FillSubscriber
member.summary: PlanCur.Subscriber is one value that is always kept in synch with the display. If program changes PlanCur.Subscriber, then it will run this method to update the display. If user changes display, then _MouseDown is run to update the PlanCur.Subscriber. On the other hand, the subscriberID text will always be updated rather than the actual subscriberID which does not get updated until OK_click.

member.name: M:OpenDental.FormTasks.AnyAreMarkedComplete(OpenDental.TaskList)
member.summary: A recursive function that checks every child in a list IsFromRepeating. If any are marked complete, then it returns true, signifying that this list should be immune from being deleted since it's already in use.

member.name: M:OpenDental.FormTasks.DuplicateExistingList(OpenDental.TaskList,System.Boolean)
member.summary: A recursive function that duplicates an entire existing TaskList. For the initial loop, make changes to the original taskList before passing it in. That way, Date and type are only set in initial loop. All children preserve original dates and types. The isRepeating value will be applied in all loops. Also, make sure to change the parent num to the new one before calling this function. The taskListNum will always change, because we are inserting new record into database.

member.name: M:OpenDental.FormTasks.DeleteEntireList(OpenDental.TaskList)
member.summary: A recursive function that deletes the specified list and all children.
