member.summary: A single line of payment info in the Account. Might be an actual payment, or an unattached paysplit, or a daily summary of attached paysplits.

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayInfo.Type
member.summary: Payment,PaySplit, or DailySummary.

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayInfo.Amount
member.summary: The amount that will affect the balance. Other amounts should be included in the description instead.

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayInfo.PayNum
member.summary: The payment to which this info refers.

member.name: T:OpenDental.PayInfoType
member.summary: Used by PayInfo to display lines in Account.

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayInfoType.Payment
member.summary: A payment line. The entire payment amount does not necessarily affect the balance. Splits only affect the balance here if they have the same date and patNum as the payment. Whether or not they are attached to procedures, they will be included. DailySummaries never show for paysplits with same date as payment.

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayInfoType.PaySplit
member.summary: A single paysplit. The date or patNum is different than the payment, but not attached to a procedure. So balance is affected.

member.name: F:OpenDental.PayInfoType.DailySummary
member.summary: Informational only. Does not affect balance. A group of all paysplits with the same date and patnum. All are attached to procedures. Balance is affected by individual line item entries on the procedure lines.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ContrDocs.RecCrop
member.summary: This is the blue crop rectangle. It is in PictureBox coordinates. The math to convert to image coordinates is handled in the mouseup event.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ContrDocs.RecZoom
member.summary: Think of this as a rectangle laid on the ImageCurrent which represents the portion of the image to be displayed depending on the zoom level. It always starts out bigger than the actual image, but can be shrunk by zooming in. It always has exactly the same proportions as the PictureBox.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ContrDocs.MouseDownOrigin
member.summary: When dragging on Picturebox, this is the starting point in PictureBox coordinates.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ContrDocs.RecTempZoom
member.summary: During dragging, this rectangle is used just like RecZoom, but is only temporary.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ContrDocs.AutoCrop
member.summary: I am very unhappy with the accuracy of this auto crop tool. I think it's because GetPixel is so incredibly slow that I had to skip some pixels. This will be revisited later.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ContrDocs.ScanImage(System.String)
member.summary: Valid values for scanType are "doc","xray",and "photo"

member.summary: Make sure to set enhanced to false if no Documents.Cur

member.name: M:OpenDental.ContrDocs.GetSourceRect
member.summary: Gets the original source rectangle representing the portion of ImageCurrent to display. Always bigger than ImageCurrent and in proportions of PictureBox client area. Always white space on one side which depends on the rotation, flip, and proportions. Used to set initial RecZoom as well as to test when zooming out and dragging to make sure it stays within allowed bounds.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ContrDocs.GetWhiteSide
member.summary: Returns either L,R,T,or B to indicate which side of the original source rectangle the white space is on. But the source rectangle will already be rotated and flipped into the proper orientation before considering which side. So the side is not in image coordinates. This is used in GetSourceRect. Also by comparing source rect with ImageCurrent, a simple subtraction will tell the amount of white space. This is used when zooming and dragging to keep the image from going outside the bounds of pict box.

member.name: T:OpenDental.ClaimProcStatus
member.summary: Claimproc Status. The status must generally be the same as the claim, although it is sometimes not strictly enforced.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProcStatus.NotReceived
member.summary: 0: For claims that have been created or sent, but have not been received.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProcStatus.Received
member.summary: 1: For claims that have been received.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProcStatus.Preauth
member.summary: 2: For preauthorizations.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProcStatus.Adjustment
member.summary: 3: The only place that this status is used is to make adjustments to benefits from the coverage window. It is never attached to a claim.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProcStatus.Supplemental
member.summary: 4:This differs from Received only slightly. It's for additional payments on procedures already received. Most fields are blank.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProcStatus.CapClaim
member.summary: 5: CapClaim is used when you want to send a claim to a capitation insurance company. These are similar to Supplemental in that there will always be a duplicate claimproc for a procedure. The first claimproc tracks the copay and writeoff, has a status of CapComplete, and is never attached to a claim. The second claimproc has status of CapClaim.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProcStatus.Estimate
member.summary: 6: Estimates have replaced the fields that were in the procedure table. Once a procedure is complete, the claimprocstatus will still be Estimate. An Estimate can be attached to a claim and status gets changed to NotReceived.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProcStatus.CapComplete
member.summary: 7: For capitation procedures that are complete. This replaces the old procedurelog.CapCoPay field. This stores the copay and writeoff amounts. The copay is only there for reference, while it is the writeoff that actually affects the balance. Never attached to a claim. If procedure is TP, then status will be CapEstimate. Only set to CapComplete if procedure is Complete.

member.name: F:OpenDental.ClaimProcStatus.CapEstimate
member.summary: 8: For capitation procedures that are still estimates rather than complete. When procedure is completed, this can be changed to CapComplete, but never to anything else.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Tooth.ToInternat(System.String)
member.summary: Sometimes validated by IsValidDB before coming here, otherwise an invalid toothnum . This should be run on all displayed tooth numbers. It will handle checking for whether user is using international tooth numbers. All tooth numbers are passed in american values until the very last moment. Just before display, the string is converted using this method.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Tooth.FromInternat(System.String)
member.summary: MUST be validated by IsValidEntry before coming here. All user entered toothnumbers are run through this method which automatically checks to see if using international toothnumbers. So the procedure struct will always contain the american toothnum.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Tooth.IsValidEntry(System.String)
member.summary: Used every time user enters toothNum in procedure box. Must be followed with FromInternat. These are the *ONLY* methods that are designed to accept user input. Can also handle international toothnum

member.name: M:OpenDental.Tooth.IsValidDB(System.String)
member.summary: Intended to validate toothNum coming in from database. Will not handle any international tooth nums since all database teeth are in US format.

member.name: P:OpenDental.Reporting.ReportObject.FormatString
member.summary: For a FieldObject, a C# format string that specifies how to print dates, times, numbers, and currency based on the country or on a custom format.
member.remarks: There are a LOT of options for this string. Look in C# help under Standard Numeric Format Strings, Custom Numeric Format Strings, Standard DateTime Format Strings, Custom DateTime Format Strings, and Enumeration Format Strings. Once users are allowed to edit reports, we will assemble a help page with all of the common options. The best options are "n" for number, and "d" for date.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Reporting.ParameterField
member.summary: Holds information about a parameter used in the report.
member.remarks: A parameter is a string that can be used in a query that will be replaced by user-provided data before the query is sent. For instance, "?date1" might be replaced with "(ProcDate = '2004-02-17' OR ProcDate = '2004-02-18')". The output value can be multiple items connected with OR's as in the example, or it can be a single value. The Snippet represents one of the multiple values. In this example, it would be "ProcDate = '?'". The ? in the Snippet will be replaced by the values provided by the user.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Reporting.ParameterField.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor. Used when retrieving data from db.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Reporting.ParameterField.ApplyParamValues
member.summary: Applies a value to the specified parameter field of a report. The currentValues is usually just a single value. The only time there will be multiple values is for a def or an enum. For example, if a user selects multiple items from a dropdown box for this parameter, then each item is connected by an OR. The entire output value is surrounded by parentheses.

member.name: P:OpenDental.Reporting.ParameterField.Name
member.summary: This is the name as it will show in the query, but without the preceding question mark.

member.name: P:OpenDental.Reporting.ParameterField.OutputValue
member.summary: The value, in text form, as it will be substituted into the main query and sent to the database.

member.name: P:OpenDental.Reporting.ParameterField.ValueType
member.summary: The type of value that the parameter can accept.

member.name: P:OpenDental.Reporting.ParameterField.CurrentValues
member.summary: The values of the parameter, typically just one. Each value can be a string, date, number, currency, Boolean, etc. If the length of the ArrayList is 0, then the value is blank and will not be used in the query.

member.name: P:OpenDental.Reporting.ParameterField.DefaultValues
member.summary: These values are stored between sessions in the database and will show in the dialog prefilled when it asks the user for values. The length of the ArrayList can be 0 to specify that the initial value is blank.

member.name: P:OpenDental.Reporting.ParameterField.PromptingText
member.summary: The text that prompts the user what to enter for this parameter.

member.name: P:OpenDental.Reporting.ParameterField.Snippet
member.summary: The snippet of SQL that will be repeated once for each value supplied by the user, connected with OR's, and surrounded by parentheses.

member.name: P:OpenDental.Reporting.ParameterField.EnumerationType
member.summary: If the ValueKind is EnumField, then this specifies which type of enum. It is the string name of the type.

member.name: P:OpenDental.Reporting.ParameterField.DefCategory
member.summary: If ValueKind is DefParameter, then this specifies which DefCat.

member.name: P:OpenDental.Reporting.ParameterField.FKeyType
member.summary: If ValueKind is ForeignKey, then this specifies which one.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldValueType
member.summary: Specifies the type of value that the field will accept. Used in ParameterDef.ValueType and ReportObject.ValueType properties. Also used in the ContrMultInput control to determine what kind of input to display.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldValueType.Date
member.summary: Field takes a date value.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldValueType.String
member.summary: Field takes a string value.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldValueType.Boolean
member.summary: Field takes a boolean value. For a Parameter, if false, then the snippet will not even be included. Because of the way this is implemented, the snippet can specify a true or false value, and the user can select whether to include the snippet. So the parameter can specify whether to include a false value among many other possibilities. There should not be a ? in a boolean snippet.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldValueType.Integer
member.summary: Field takes an integer value.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldValueType.Number
member.summary: Field takes a number(double) value which can include a decimal.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldValueType.Enum
member.summary: Field takes an enumeration value(s), usually in int form from a dropdown list.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldValueType.Def
member.summary: Field takes definition.DefNum value from a def category. Presented to user as a dropdown list for that category.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.FieldValueType.Age
member.summary: Only used in ReportObject. When a table comes back from the database, if the expected value is an age, then this column type should be used. Just retreive the birthdate and the program will convert it to an age.

member.name: T:OpenDental.Reporting.Report
member.summary: This is the new report class which is gradually replacing the old Report struct. This class is loosely modeled after CrystalReports.ReportDocument, but with less inheritence and heirarchy.

member.name: F:OpenDental.Reporting.Report.grfx
member.summary: This is simply used to measure strings for alignment purposes.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Reporting.Report.#ctor
member.summary: When a new Report is created, the only section that is added is the details. This makes the logic a little more complicated, but it will minimize calls to the database for unused sections. This also makes the act of adding groups more natural.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Reporting.Report.AddTitle(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a ReportObject large, centered, and bold, to the top of the Report Header Section. Should only be done once, and done before any subTitles.
member.param: The text of the title.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Reporting.Report.AddSubTitle(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a ReportObject, centered and bold, at the bottom of the Report Header Section. Should only be done after AddTitle. You can add as many subtitles as you want.
member.param: The text of the subtitle.

member.name: M:OpenDental.Reporting.Report.AddColumn(System.String,System.Int32,OpenDental.Reporting.FieldValueType)
member.summary: Adds all the objects necessary for a typical column, including the textObject for column header and the fieldObject for the data. Does not add lines or shading. If the column is type Double, then the alignment is set right and a total field is added. Also, default formatstrings are set for dates and doubles.
member.param: The name of the column title as well as the dataField to add.

member.name: T:OpenDental.UI.ContrMultInput
member.summary: This control can be used anywhere that the user can enter a series of values.
member.remarks: Typically used in reports to let the user specify the parameters. Will also be used in the Patient Edit window for custom fields, etc. Each item in the list can be of a different input type, and this control will dynamically arrange them from the top down. It adapts to many different widths. If the input fields extend beyond the lower edge of the control, then a scrollbar is added. This control can also be used for a series of values that are not to be displayed, but not altered.

member.name: M:OpenDental.UI.ContrMultInput.AllFieldsAreValid
member.summary: Called externally to determine whether any of the fields are displaying errors. Typically used in the OK_Click of the parent form to prevent closing if any field entries are invalid.

member.name: T:OpenDental.UI.MultInputItem
member.summary: A single input item in the ContrMultInput control.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.MultInputItem.PromptingText
member.summary: The text that prompts the user what information to enter.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.MultInputItem.ValueType
member.summary: The type of input that this item accepts. Each input type displays a different input control for this item.

member.name: F:OpenDental.UI.MultInputItem.CurrentValues
member.summary: A collection of the actual values of this item, not just the displayed text. Any supported type is allowed including string, int, double, bool, datetime, etc. The length of the ArrayList can be set to 0 ahead of time if there are no default values to fill in the input field with. The result is that the field will initially be blank. After the user input, if the field is still blank, then the count will still be 0. If the count is 0, then this parameter will not be included as a filter in the query.

member.name: M:OpenDental.ContrApptSingle.GetPatternShowing(System.String)
member.summary: This converts the dbPattern in 5 minute interval into the pattern that will be viewed based on RowsPerIncrement and AppointmentTimeIncrement. So it will always depend on the current view.Therefore, it should only be used for visual display purposes rather than within the FormAptEdit. If height of appointment allows a half row, then this includes an increment for that half row.

member.summary: Saves the cur exam measurements to the db by looping through each tooth and deciding whether the data for that tooth has changed. If so, it either updates or inserts a measurement. It won't delete a measurement if all values for that tooth are cleared, but just sets that measurement to all -1's.
